required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Test the Combination of Voriconazole and Anidulafungin in Patients Who Have, or Are Thought to Have, Invasive Aspergillosis and Who Are Unable to Take a Common Antifungal Therapy (Polyene)
clinical_study.official_title: Phase IV Open-Label Pilot Study to Evaluate the Combination of Voriconazole and Anidulafungin for the Treatment of Subjects With Proven or Probable Invasive Aspergillosis Who Are Intolerant of Polyene Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test the effectiveness and the safety of giving two antifungal agents (voriconazole and anidulafungin) together to treat invasive aspergillosis in patients who are unable to tolerate polyene therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was terminated on January 12, 2009 due to the overall low rate of enrollment. The decision to terminate the trial was not based on any safety concerns. Patients who were enrolled in the study prior to January 12, 2009 were allowed to remain in the study until completing their participation as specified in the protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: Summary of Global Response at End of Treatment (EOT)

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Global Response at Week 2, Week 4, and Week 6
Galactomannan Titer Assay Levels and Global Response
Voriconazole Trough Levels With Intravenous and Oral Dosing

intervention.description: Subjects with creatinine clearance at least 50 ml/min will receive initial treatment with IV (loading dose of 6 mg/kg Q12h followed by maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg Q12h) or oral (loading dose of 400 mg Q12h followed by maintenance dose of 300 mg Q12h). Subjects with creatinine clearance <50 ml/min will receive oral voriconazole (loading dose of 400 mg Q12h followed by maintenance dose of 300 mg Q12h).
Loading dose of 200 mg QD followed by maintenance dose of 100 mg QD for up to a total of 28 days therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Proven or probable invasive aspergillosis. Patient is intolerant to polyene therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients with invasive aspergillosis for more than 30 days at the time of study entry. Patients with uncontrolled bacterial or viral infection at the time of study entry. Patients with significant liver dysfunction or who are taking certain medications which interact with voriconazole.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Study was closed due to an overall low rate of enrollment after only 6 subjects enrolled.

group.title: Anidulalfungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Voriconazole: subjects with creatinine clearance at least 50 milliliters per minute (ml/min) will receive initial treatment with intravenous (IV) (loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram [mg/kg] every 12 hours [Q12h]) followed by maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg Q12h or oral (PO) (loading dose of 400 mg Q12h followed by maintenance dose of 300 mg Q12h). Subjects with creatinine clearance <50 ml/min will receive oral Voriconazole (loading dose of 400 mg Q12h followed by maintenance dose of 300 mg Q12h). Anidulafungin: loading dose of 200 mg once daily (QD) followed by maintenance dose of 100 mg QD for up to a total of 28 days therapy. Subjects remain on combination therapy for minimum of 14 days and a maximum of 28 days; after combination therapy complete, subjects may remain on a maintenance dose of Voriconazole monotherapy until Day 42.

group.title: Anidulalfungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Voriconazole: subjects with creatinine clearance at least 50 milliliters per minute (ml/min) will receive initial treatment with intravenous (IV) (loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram [mg/kg] every 12 hours [Q12h]) followed by maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg Q12h or oral (PO) (loading dose of 400 mg Q12h followed by maintenance dose of 300 mg Q12h). Subjects with creatinine clearance <50 ml/min will receive oral Voriconazole (loading dose of 400 mg Q12h followed by maintenance dose of 300 mg Q12h). Anidulafungin: loading dose of 200 mg once daily (QD) followed by maintenance dose of 100 mg QD for up to a total of 28 days therapy. Subjects remain on combination therapy for minimum of 14 days and a maximum of 28 days; after combination therapy complete, subjects may remain on a maintenance dose of Voriconazole monotherapy until Day 42.

outcome.title: Summary of Global Response at End of Treatment (EOT)
outcome.description: Number of subjects with global response consisting of a combination of clinical and radiological findings at the end of therapy. Possible outcome categories: Complete Response: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms and more than 90% of lesions due to invasive aspergillosis that were visible on radiological studies; Partial Response: clinical improvement and greater than 50% improvement in radiological findings; Stable Response: no change from baseline or an improvement of less than 50% in radiological findings; Failure (no response): worsening disease.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): includes all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication. No descriptive or inferential analysis was completed due to low enrollment and subsequent early termination of study.

group.title: Anidulalfungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin and voriconazole in combination followed by monotherapy.

measure.title: Summary of Global Response at End of Treatment (EOT)
measure.description: Number of subjects with global response consisting of a combination of clinical and radiological findings at the end of therapy. Possible outcome categories: Complete Response: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms and more than 90% of lesions due to invasive aspergillosis that were visible on radiological studies; Partial Response: clinical improvement and greater than 50% improvement in radiological findings; Stable Response: no change from baseline or an improvement of less than 50% in radiological findings; Failure (no response): worsening disease.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): includes all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication. No descriptive or inferential analysis was completed due to low enrollment and subsequent early termination of study.

outcome.title: Summary of Global Response at Week 2, Week 4, and Week 6
outcome.description: Number of subjects with global response consisting of a combination of clinical and radiological findings at the end of therapy. Possible outcome categories: Complete Response: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms and more than 90% of lesions due to invasive aspergillosis that were visible on radiological studies; Partial Response: clinical improvement and greater than 50% improvement in radiological findings; Stable Response: no change from baseline or an improvement of less than 50% in radiological findings; Failure (no response): worsening disease.
outcome.population: ITT; due to low study enrollment, data not summarized by global response at Week 2, Week 4, and Week 6. Cross-reference outcome measure: Summary of Global Response at End of Treatment (EOT).

group.title: Anidulalfungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin and voriconazole in combination followed by monotherapy.

measure.title: Summary of Global Response at Week 2, Week 4, and Week 6
measure.description: Number of subjects with global response consisting of a combination of clinical and radiological findings at the end of therapy. Possible outcome categories: Complete Response: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms and more than 90% of lesions due to invasive aspergillosis that were visible on radiological studies; Partial Response: clinical improvement and greater than 50% improvement in radiological findings; Stable Response: no change from baseline or an improvement of less than 50% in radiological findings; Failure (no response): worsening disease.
measure.population: ITT; due to low study enrollment, data not summarized by global response at Week 2, Week 4, and Week 6. Cross-reference outcome measure: Summary of Global Response at End of Treatment (EOT).

outcome.title: Summary of Mortality
outcome.description: Number of subects with documented mortality (death).

group.title: Anidulalfungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin and voriconazole in combination followed by monotherapy.

measure.title: Summary of Mortality
measure.description: Number of subects with documented mortality (death).

outcome.title: Galactomannan Titer Assay Levels and Global Response
outcome.description: Number of subjects per Galactomannan titer level with global response for all subjects (with or without renal impairment). The galactomann assay is an immunological blood serum test used to diagnose invasive aspergillosis and to monitor disease progression. Global response is a composite of clinical and radiological findings summarized as Complete Response: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms; Partial Response: clinical improvement; Stable Response: no change from baseline or an improvement of less than 50% in radiological findings; Failure (no response): worsening disease.
outcome.population: ITT. No descriptive or inferential analysis was completed due to low enrollment and subsequent early termination of study.

group.title: Anidulalfungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin and voriconazole in combination followed by monotherapy.

measure.title: Galactomannan Titer Assay Levels and Global Response
measure.description: Number of subjects per Galactomannan titer level with global response for all subjects (with or without renal impairment). The galactomann assay is an immunological blood serum test used to diagnose invasive aspergillosis and to monitor disease progression. Global response is a composite of clinical and radiological findings summarized as Complete Response: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms; Partial Response: clinical improvement; Stable Response: no change from baseline or an improvement of less than 50% in radiological findings; Failure (no response): worsening disease.
measure.population: ITT. No descriptive or inferential analysis was completed due to low enrollment and subsequent early termination of study.

outcome.title: Voriconazole Trough Levels With Intravenous and Oral Dosing
outcome.description: Voriconazole trough plasma concentrations measured as nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).
outcome.population: ITT; only 1 pharmacokinetic sample was collected for each subject, therefore a comprehensive analysis of trough plasma concentrations was not completed due to insufficient data.

group.title: Anidulalfungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin and voriconazole in combination followed by monotherapy.

measure.title: Voriconazole Trough Levels With Intravenous and Oral Dosing
measure.description: Voriconazole trough plasma concentrations measured as nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).
measure.population: ITT; only 1 pharmacokinetic sample was collected for each subject, therefore a comprehensive analysis of trough plasma concentrations was not completed due to insufficient data.

group.title: Anidulalfungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Voriconazole: subjects with creatinine clearance at least 50 milliliters per minute (ml/min) will receive initial treatment with intravenous (IV) (loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram [mg/kg] every 12 hours [Q12h]) followed by maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg Q12h or oral (PO) (loading dose of 400 mg Q12h followed by maintenance dose of 300 mg Q12h). Subjects with creatinine clearance <50 ml/min will receive oral Voriconazole (loading dose of 400 mg Q12h followed by maintenance dose of 300 mg Q12h). Anidulafungin: loading dose of 200 mg once daily (QD) followed by maintenance dose of 100 mg QD for up to a total of 28 days therapy. Subjects remain on combination therapy for minimum of 14 days and a maximum of 28 days; after combination therapy complete, subjects may remain on a maintenance dose of Voriconazole monotherapy until Day 42.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to low enrollment and early termination of the study, data was insufficient for descriptive or inferential analysis as planned; no significant treatment-related safety results were identified in the subjects treated with combination therapy.
